snippet: Officials said inflation slowed in January to an annual 0.3 percent — the lowest pace on record — in the face of falling energy prices and supermarket price wars.
abstract: Britain's Office for National Statistics reports inflation slowed in January to annual rate of 0.3 percent, lowest pace on record; attributes decline to falling energy prices and supermarket price wars.
lead_paragraph: Officials said inflation slowed in January to an annual 0.3 percent — the lowest pace on record — in the face of falling energy prices and supermarket price wars.

headline.main: British Inflation Slows to Record Low Pace
headline.print_headline: British Inflation Slows to Record Low Pace
